title.narrative: Food Security Program with Citihope- Dominican Republic- 2013

description.narrative:
With 42% of the population below the poverty line, food shortage is prevalent throughout the Dominican Republic. CitiHope provides food and other resources to health facilities including maternal hospitals, schools, orphanages and other needy people and takes an active role in the distribution and monitoring. CitiHope supports sustainable educational and development programs that empower locals to create strong, self-sufficient communities.
Citihope's country director in the Dominican Republic says, "We consider this not to be 'charity' but a real investment in humanity. The school and orphanage programs help our country so much by creating a future of responsible citizens that contribute to the improvement of our society. These children come from families that cannot supply even one meal a day for their children and don't understand the purpose of education. So the motivation comes from the food!...These Stop Hunger Now donations are a defining component that heals a nation, multi-dimensionally."
The addition of Stop Hunger Now meals enables CitiHope to provide for the nutritional needs of the students, mothers and other beneficiaries enrolled in their development programs.
